alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 11:18AM EST until December 28 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek at Langhorne. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Thursday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 2.2 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 03/31/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 9.3 Thu 10 a 3.2 2.4 Crested and Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
